hotspots.label: Wind Turbine Blades
hotspots.fact: These giant blades spin in the wind to generate electricity for homes and schools. Each blade can be as long as a school bus, and they can spin up to 15 times per minute!

hotspots.label: Tall Tower Structure
hotspots.fact: Wind turbines are built very tall so they can reach stronger winds high in the sky. Some turbines are taller than the Statue of Liberty!

hotspots.label: Farmland Below
hotspots.fact: Wind farms can be built on farmland because the land below the turbines can still be used to grow crops. Farmers benefit from clean energy while continuing to farm!

hotspots.label: Power Lines
hotspots.fact: These cables carry electricity generated by wind turbines to towns and cities far away. One turbine can power about 600 homes with clean, renewable energy!
